trans-unit.source: Seeking always discards the internal buffer, even if the seek position would otherwise fall within it. This guarantees that calling BufReader::into_inner() immediately after a seek yields the underlying reader at the same position.
trans-unit.target: 搜寻总是会丢弃内部缓冲区，即使寻找位置本来会落在内部缓冲区内。这保证了在查找之后立即调用 BufReader::into_inner() 在相同位置产生基础阅读器。

trans-unit.source: Seeking always discards the internal buffer, even if the seek position would otherwise fall within it. This guarantees that calling .into_inner() immediately after a seek yields the underlying reader at the same position.
trans-unit.target: 搜寻总是会丢弃内部缓冲区，即使寻找位置本来会落在内部缓冲区内。这保证了在查找之后立即调用 .into_inner() 会在相同位置产生基础阅读器。

trans-unit.source: Seeking always writes out the internal buffer before seeking.
trans-unit.target: Seeking总是在寻求前写出内部缓冲区。

trans-unit.source: Seeking to a negative offset is considered an error.
trans-unit.target: 寻求负偏移被认为是错误的。

trans-unit.source: Seeks relative to the current position. If the new position lies within the buffer, the buffer will not be flushed, allowing for more efficient seeks. This method does not return the location of the underlying reader, so the caller must track this information themselves if it is required.
trans-unit.target: 相对于当前位置的搜索。如果新的位置位于缓冲区内,缓冲区将不会被刷新,允许更高效的查找。本方法不返回底层读卡器的位置,所以如果需要的话,调用者必须自己追踪这些信息。

trans-unit.source: Several methods on Command, such as spawn or output, can be used to spawn a process. In particular, output spawns the child process and waits until the process terminates, while spawn will return a Child that represents the spawned child process.
trans-unit.target: 可使用 Command 上的几种方法（例如 spawn 或 output )来生成进程。特别是， output 生成子进程并等待直到该进程终止，而 spawn 将返回一个代表所生成的子进程的 Child 。

trans-unit.source: Several of Rust's control structures will check for a bool condition evaluating to true.
trans-unit.target: Rust的几个控制结构将检查评估为true的 bool 条件。

trans-unit.source: Several of the other (forward) methods have default implementations in terms of this one, so try to implement this explicitly if it can do something better than the default for loop implementation.
trans-unit.target: 就此而言，其他几种（转发）方法都具有默认实现，因此，如果它可以做得比默认的 for 循环实现更好，请尝试显式实现。

trans-unit.source: Several other collection methods also return iterators to yield a sequence of results but avoid allocating an entire collection to store the result in. This provides maximum flexibility as collect or extend can be called to "pipe" the sequence into any collection if desired. Otherwise, the sequence can be looped over with a for loop. The iterator can also be discarded after partial use, preventing the computation of the unused items.
trans-unit.target: 其他几种收集方法也返回迭代器以产生结果序列，但避免分配整个集合来存储结果。这提供了最大的灵活性，因为可以根据需要调用 collect 或 extend 将序列“管道”到任何集合中。否则，可以使用 for 循环将序列循环。迭代器在部分使用后也可以丢弃，从而避免了未使用项的计算。

trans-unit.source: Several rules determine what a package can contain. A package must contain zero or one library crates, and no more. It can contain as many binary crates as you’d like, but it must contain at least one crate (either library or binary).
trans-unit.target: 几个规则确定软件包可以包含的内容。一个程序包必须包含零个或一个库条板箱，并且不能包含更多。它可以包含任意数量的二进制板条箱，但必须至少包含一个板条箱（库或二进制）。

trans-unit.source: Shadowing is different from marking a variable as mut, because we’ll get a compile-time error if we accidentally try to reassign to this variable without using the let keyword. By using let, we can perform a few transformations on a value but have the variable be immutable after those transformations have been completed.
trans-unit.target: 阴影不同于将变量标记为 mut ，因为如果我们不小心尝试不使用 let 关键字重新分配给该变量，就会收到编译时错误。通过使用 let ，我们可以对一个值执行一些转换，但是在这些转换完成之后，变量是不可变的。

trans-unit.source: Shareable mutable containers exist to permit mutability in a controlled manner, even in the presence of aliasing. Both Cell<T> and RefCell<T> allow doing this in a single-threaded way. However, neither Cell<T> nor RefCell<T> are thread safe (they do not implement Sync). If you need to do aliasing and mutation between multiple threads it is possible to use Mutex, RwLock or atomic types.
trans-unit.target: 存在可共享的可变容器，以允许以受控的方式进行可变性，即使存在混叠也是如此。两者 Cell<T> 和 RefCell<T> 允许在单线程方式这样做。但是， Cell<T> 和 RefCell<T> 都不是线程安全的（它们不实现 Sync ）。如果需要在多个线程之间进行别名和突变，则可以使用 Mutex ， RwLock 或 atomic 类型。

trans-unit.source: Shared borrows, except if applied to a type with interior mutability.
trans-unit.target: 共享借位，除非应用于具有内部可变性的类型。

trans-unit.source: Shared references can be copied, but mutable references cannot!

trans-unit.source: Shared references in Rust disallow mutation by default, and Rc is no exception: you cannot generally obtain a mutable reference to something inside an Rc. If you need mutability, put a Cell or RefCell inside the Rc; see an example of mutability inside an Rc.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下，Rust中的共享引用不允许更改， Rc 也不例外：您通常无法获得对 Rc 内部内容的可变引用。如果需要可变性，可在 Rc 内放置一个 Cell 或 RefCell ；请参阅 Rc 内部的可变性示例。

trans-unit.source: Shared references in Rust disallow mutation by default, and Rc is no exception: you cannot generally obtain a mutable reference to something inside an Rc. If you need mutability, put a Cell or RefCell inside the Rc; see an example of mutability inside an Rc.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下，Rust中的共享引用不允许更改， Rc 也不例外：您通常无法获得对 Rc 内部内容的可变引用。如果需要可变性，可在 Rc 内放置一个 Cell 或 RefCell ；请参阅Rc内部的可变性示例。

trans-unit.source: Shared references in Rust disallow mutation by default, and Arc is no exception: you cannot generally obtain a mutable reference to something inside an Arc. If you need to mutate through an Arc, use Mutex, RwLock, or one of the Atomic types.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下，Rust中的共享引用不允许更改，并且 Arc 也不例外：您通常无法获得对 Arc 内部内容的可变引用。如果需要通过 Arc 进行突变，请使用 Mutex ， RwLock 或 Atomic 类型之一。

trans-unit.source: Sharing code with Cargo and crates.io is part of what makes the Rust ecosystem useful for many different tasks. Rust’s standard library is small and stable, but crates are easy to share, use, and improve on a timeline different from that of the language. Don’t be shy about sharing code that’s useful to you on crates.io; it’s likely that it will be useful to someone else as well!
trans-unit.target: 与Cargo和crates.io共享代码是使Rust生态系统可用于许多不同任务的一部分。Rust的标准库虽小且稳定，但在与语言不同的时间轴上，易于共享，使用和改进包装。不要在crates.io上共享对您有用的代码；可能对其他人也有用！

trans-unit.source: Significantly, closure expressions capture their environment, which regular function definitions do not. Without the move keyword, the closure expression infers how it captures each variable from its environment, preferring to capture by shared reference, effectively borrowing all outer variables mentioned inside the closure's body. If needed the compiler will infer that instead mutable references should be taken, or that the values should be moved or copied (depending on their type) from the environment. A closure can be forced to capture its environment by copying or moving values by prefixing it with the move keyword. This is often used to ensure that the closure's type is 'static.
trans-unit.target: 重要的是，闭包表达式捕获了它们的环境，而常规函数定义则没有。如果没有 move 关键字，则闭包表达式可以推断出它如何从其环境中捕获每个变量，而更喜欢通过共享引用捕获，从而有效地借用了闭包主体中提到的所有外部变量。如果需要，编译器将推断应该取可变引用，或者应该从环境中移动或复制值（取决于它们的类型）。闭包可以通过复制或移动值（通过在其前面加上 move 关键字）来强制捕获其环境。这通常用于确保闭包的类型为 'static 。

trans-unit.source: Similar in construction to if let, the while let conditional loop allows a while loop to run for as long as a pattern continues to match. trans-unit.source: Similar to request_review, if we call the approve method on a Draft, it will have no effect because it will return self. When we call approve on PendingReview, it returns a new, boxed instance of the Published struct. The Published struct implements the State trait, and for both the request_review method and the approve method, it returns itself, because the post should stay in the Published state in those cases.
trans-unit.target: 与 request_review 相似，如果我们在 Draft 上调用 approve 方法，则该方法将无效，因为它将返回 self 。当我们在 PendingReview 上调用 approve 时，它返回框内的 Published 结构的新实例。该 Published 结构实现的 State 特质，并为双方 request_review 方法和 approve 的方法，它返回自身，因为该职位应该留在 Published 状态的情况下。

trans-unit.source: Simply put, a type T implements UnwindSafe if it cannot easily allow witnessing a broken invariant through the use of catch_unwind (catching a panic). trans-unit.source: Since VecDeque is a ring buffer, its elements are not necessarily contiguous in memory. If you want to access the elements as a single slice, such as for efficient sorting, you can use make_contiguous. It rotates the VecDeque so that its elements do not wrap, and returns a mutable slice to the now-contiguous element sequence.
trans-unit.target: 由于 VecDeque 是环形缓冲区，因此其元素在内存中不一定是连续的。如果要将元素作为单个切片访问（例如进行有效排序），则可以使用 make_contiguous 。它旋转 VecDeque ，以使其元素不环绕，并将可变切片返回到现在连续的元素序列。

trans-unit.source: Since VecDeque is a ring buffer, its elements are not necessarily contiguous in memory. trans-unit.source: Since Rust itself has no notion of immovable types, and considers moves (e.g. through assignment or mem::replace) to always be safe, this trait cannot prevent types from moving by itself.
trans-unit.target: 由于Rust本身没有固定类型的概念，并且认为移动（例如，通过赋值或 mem::replace ）始终是安全的，因此此特征不能阻止类型自行移动。

trans-unit.source: Since a Weak reference does not count towards ownership, it will not prevent the inner value from being dropped, and Weak itself makes no guarantees about the value still being present and may return None when upgraded.
trans-unit.target: 由于“ Weak 引用”不计入所有权，因此它不会防止内部价值下降，并且“ Weak 本身不保证该价值仍然存在，并且在 upgrade d 时可能返回“ None 。

trans-unit.source: Since a Weak reference does not count towards ownership, it will not prevent the value stored in the allocation from being dropped, and Weak itself makes no guarantees about the value still being present. Thus it may return None when upgraded. Note however that a Weak reference does prevent the allocation itself (the backing store) from being deallocated.
trans-unit.target: 由于 Weak 引用不计入所有权，因此它不能防止分配中存储的值被丢弃，并且 Weak 本身不能保证仍然存在该值。因此， upgrade d时它可能会返回 None 。但是请注意， Weak 引用确实会阻止分配本身（后备存储）被释放。

trans-unit.source: Since a trait object can contain references, the lifetimes of those references need to be expressed as part of the trait object. This lifetime is written as Trait + 'a. There are defaults that allow this lifetime to usually be inferred with a sensible choice.

trans-unit.source: Since union fields share common storage, gaining write access to one field of a union can give write access to all its remaining fields. Borrow checking rules have to be adjusted to account for this fact. As a result, if one field of a union is borrowed, all its remaining fields are borrowed as well for the same lifetime.
trans-unit.target: 由于联合字段共享共同的存储空间,获得对联合字段的写访问权,就可以获得对其余所有字段的写访问权。借用检查规则必须进行调整以考虑到这个事实。因此,如果一个联合体的一个字段被借用,那么它的所有剩余字段也会在相同的生命周期内被借用。

trans-unit.source: Smart pointers are usually implemented using structs. The characteristic that distinguishes a smart pointer from an ordinary struct is that smart pointers implement the Deref and Drop traits. The Deref trait allows an instance of the smart pointer struct to behave like a reference so you can write code that works with either references or smart pointers. The Drop trait allows you to customize the code that is run when an instance of the smart pointer goes out of scope. In this chapter, we’ll discuss both traits and demonstrate why they’re important to smart pointers.
trans-unit.target: 智能指针通常使用结构来实现。将智能指针与普通结构区分开的特征是，智能指针实现了 Deref 和 Drop 特性。该 Deref 特质使得智能指针结构的实例表现得像一个参考，所以你可以编写与任何引用或智能指针运行的代码。该 Drop 特质，可以自定义当智能指针的实例出现的范围之所运行的代码。在本章中，我们将讨论这两种特性，并说明它们为什么对智能指针很重要。

trans-unit.source: So ref x, V(ref x) and [ref x, y] are all extending patterns, but x, &ref x and &(ref x,) are not.

trans-unit.source: So although a &T is a single value that stores the memory address of where the T is located, a &str is two values: the address of the str and its length. As such, we can know the size of a &str value at compile time: it’s twice the length of a usize. That is, we always know the size of a &str, no matter how long the string it refers to is. In general, this is the way in which dynamically sized types are used in Rust: they have an extra bit of metadata that stores the size of the dynamic information. The golden rule of dynamically sized types is that we must always put values of dynamically sized types behind a pointer of some kind.
trans-unit.target: 因此，尽管一个 &T 是一个单一的值，其存储的，其中的存储器地址 T 位于，一个 &str 是2个值：地址 str 和其长度。这样，我们可以在编译时知道 &str 值的大小：它是 usize 长度的两倍。也就是说，无论它指向的字符串有多长，我们始终知道 &str 的大小。通常，这是在Rust中使用动态大小类型的方式：它们具有额外的一点元数据，用于存储动态信息的大小。动态大小类型的黄金法则是，我们必须始终将动态大小类型的值放在某种类型的指针后面。

trans-unit.source: So far, we’ve demonstrated that calling Rc::clone increases the strong_count of an Rc<T> instance, and an Rc<T> instance is only cleaned up if its strong_count is 0. You can also create a weak reference to the value within an Rc<T> instance by calling Rc::downgrade and passing a reference to the Rc<T>. When you call Rc::downgrade, you get a smart pointer of type Weak<T>. Instead of increasing the strong_count in the Rc<T> instance by 1, calling Rc::downgrade increases the weak_count by 1. The Rc<T> type uses weak_count to keep track of how many Weak<T> references exist, similar to strong_count. The difference is the weak_count doesn’t need to be 0 for the Rc<T> instance to be cleaned up.
trans-unit.target: 到目前为止，我们已经证明，调用 Rc::clone 增加 strong_count 一个的 Rc<T> 的实例，以及 Rc<T> 实例仅清理如果 strong_count 是0。你也可以创建一个弱引用到通过调用 Rc::downgrade 并将 Rc<T> 的引用传递给 Rc<T> 实例中的值。当您调用 Rc::downgrade ，您将获得类型 Weak<T> 的智能指针。而不是将 Rc<T> 实例中的 strong_count 增加1，调用 Rc::downgrade 增加 weak_count 由1. Rc<T> 类型的用途 weak_count 跟踪多少 Weak<T> 引用存在，类似于 strong_count 。不同之处在于，要清除的 Rc<T> 实例的 weak_count 不必为0 。

trans-unit.source: So how do you decide when you should call panic! and when you should return Result? When code panics, there’s no way to recover. You could call panic! for any error situation, whether there’s a possible way to recover or not, but then you’re making the decision on behalf of the code calling your code that a situation is unrecoverable. When you choose to return a Result value, you give the calling code options rather than making the decision for it. The calling code could choose to attempt to recover in a way that’s appropriate for its situation, or it could decide that an Err value in this case is unrecoverable, so it can call panic! and turn your recoverable error into an unrecoverable one. Therefore, returning Result is a good default choice when you’re defining a function that might fail.
trans-unit.target: 因此，您如何决定何时应致电 panic! 什么时候应该返回 Result ？当代码出现紧急情况时，无法恢复。你可能会 panic! 对于任何错误情况，是否都有恢复的可能方法，但是随后您代表代码做出决定，该代码调用您的代码使情况无法恢复。当选择返回 Result 值时，您将给调用代码选项，而不是为其做出决定。调用代码可以选择尝试以适合其情况的方式进行恢复，或者可以确定这种情况下的 Err 值是不可恢复的，因此可以进行 panic! 调用！并将您的可恢复错误变成不可恢复的错误。因此，在定义可能失败的函数时，返回 Result 是一个很好的默认选择。

trans-unit.source: So how do you know which type of integer to use? If you’re unsure, Rust’s defaults are generally good choices, and integer types default to i32: this type is generally the fastest, even on 64-bit systems. The primary situation in which you’d use isize or usize is when indexing some sort of collection.
trans-unit.target: 那么，您如何知道要使用哪种类型的整数？如果不确定，Rust的默认值通常是不错的选择，整数类型的默认值是 i32 ：即使在64位系统上，这种类型通常也是最快的。您要使用 isize 或 usize 的主要情况是在对某种集合进行索引时。

trans-unit.source: Some items form an implicit scope for the declaration of sub-items. In other words, within a function or module, declarations of items can (in many cases) be mixed with the statements, control blocks, and similar artifacts that otherwise compose the item body. The meaning of these scoped items is the same as if the item was declared outside the scope — it is still a static item — except that the item's path name within the module namespace is qualified by the name of the enclosing item, or is private to the enclosing item (in the case of functions). The grammar specifies the exact locations in which sub-item declarations may appear.

trans-unit.source: Some of these traits are imported by the prelude, so they are available in every Rust program. Only operators backed by traits can be overloaded. For example, the addition operator (+) can be overloaded through the Add trait, but since the assignment operator (=) has no backing trait, there is no way of overloading its semantics. Additionally, this module does not provide any mechanism to create new operators. If traitless overloading or custom operators are required, you should look toward macros or compiler plugins to extend Rust's syntax.
trans-unit.target: 其中一些特征是通过序幕导入的，因此在每个Rust程序中都可以使用。只有具有特征支持的运算符才可以重载。例如，可以通过 Add 特质来重载加法运算符（ + ），但是由于赋值运算符（ = ）没有支持特征，因此无法重载其语义。此外，此模块不提供任何机制来创建新的运算符。如果需要无特征的重载或自定义运算符，则应使用宏或编译器插件来扩展Rust的语法。

trans-unit.source: Some types have no ownership semantics at all and are trivial to duplicate. An example is i32 and the other number types. We don't have to call .clone() to clone them, because they are marked Copy in addition to Clone. Implicit cloning is more convenient in this case. We can mark our own types Copy if all their members also are marked Copy.
trans-unit.target: 某些类型根本没有所有权语义，并且很难复制。一个示例是 i32 和其他数字类型。我们不必调用 .clone() 来克隆它们，因为除了 Clone 之外，它们还被标记为 Copy 。在这种情况下，隐式克隆更方便。我们可以标记自己的类型的 Copy ，如果他们所有的成员也被标记为 Copy 。

trans-unit.source: Some types make it possible to go from borrowed to owned, usually by implementing the Clone trait. But Clone works only for going from &T to T. The ToOwned trait generalizes Clone to construct owned data from any borrow of a given type.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes a type needs be mutated while having multiple aliases. In Rust this is achieved using a pattern called interior mutability. A type has interior mutability if its internal state can be changed through a shared reference to it. This goes against the usual requirement that the value pointed to by a shared reference is not mutated.
trans-unit.target: 有时，需要在具有多个别名的同时对类型进行突变。在Rust中，这是通过称为内部可变性的模式来实现的。如果类型的内部状态可以通过对其的共享引用进行更改，则它具有内部可变性。这违背了通常的要求，即共享引用所指向的值不可突变。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes a type needs to be mutated while having multiple aliases. In Rust this is achieved using a pattern called interior mutability. A type has interior mutability if its internal state can be changed through a shared reference to it. This goes against the usual requirement that the value pointed to by a shared reference is not mutated.
trans-unit.target: 有时，需要在具有多个别名的同时对类型进行突变。在Rust中，这是通过称为内部可变性的模式来实现的。如果类型的内部状态可以通过对其的共享引用进行更改，则它具有内部可变性。这违反了通常的要求，即共享引用所指向的值不发生突变。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes it’s useful to have default behavior for some or all of the methods in a trait instead of requiring implementations for all methods on every type. Then, as we implement the trait on a particular type, we can keep or override each method’s default behavior.
trans-unit.target: 有时，对特征中的某些或所有方法具有默认行为是有用的，而不是要求对每种类型的所有方法都实现。然后，当我们在特定类型上实现特征时，我们可以保留或覆盖每个方法的默认行为。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes we don't need to move the value. Using a reference, we can let another function borrow the value without changing its ownership. In the example below, we don't actually have to move our string to calculate_length, we can give it a reference to it with & instead.
trans-unit.target: 有时我们不需要移动价值。使用引用，我们可以让另一个函数借用该值而不更改其所有权。在下面的示例中，我们实际上不必将字符串移动到 calculate_length ，而可以使用 & 对其进行引用。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes we don't want a reference, but a duplicate. All types marked Clone can be duplicated by calling .clone(). Subsequent changes to a clone do not affect the original variable.
trans-unit.target: 有时我们不希望引用，而是重复的引用。可以通过调用 .clone() 复制所有标记为 Clone 的类型。对克隆的后续更改不会影响原始变量。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, bad things happen in your code, and there’s nothing you can do about it. In these cases, Rust has the panic! macro. When the panic! macro executes, your program will print a failure message, unwind and clean up the stack, and then quit. This most commonly occurs when a bug of some kind has been detected and it’s not clear to the programmer how to handle the error.
trans-unit.target: 有时，您的代码中会发生不好的事情，对此您无能为力。在这些情况下，Rust会 panic! 宏。当 panic! 宏执行后，您的程序将显示一条失败消息，展开并清理堆栈，然后退出。当检测到某种错误并且程序员不清楚如何处理错误时，通常会发生这种情况。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, running a full test suite can take a long time. If you’re working on code in a particular area, you might want to run only the tests pertaining to that code. You can choose which tests to run by passing cargo test the name or names of the test(s) you want to run as an argument.
trans-unit.target: 有时，运行完整的测试套件可能需要很长时间。如果您在特定区域中处理代码，则可能只想运行与该代码有关的测试。您可以通过传递 cargo test 名称作为参数来选择要运行的测试。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, you might need one trait to use another trait’s functionality. In this case, you need to rely on the dependent trait also being implemented. The trait you rely on is a supertrait of the trait you’re implementing.
trans-unit.target: 有时，您可能需要一个特征才能使用另一个特征的功能。在这种情况下，您需要依赖于也正在实现的依赖特性。您所依赖的特征是您正在实现的特征的上层特征。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, you want to fall back to some kind of default value, and don't particularly care what it is. This comes up often with structs that define a set of options:
trans-unit.target: 有时，您想退回到某种默认值，而不必特别在意它是什么。通常会用 struct 来定义一组选项：

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, you’ll see multiple messages printed for one browser request; the reason might be that the browser is making a request for the page as well as a request for other resources, like the favicon.ico icon that appears in the browser tab.
trans-unit.target: 有时，您会看到针对一个浏览器请求打印了多条消息。原因可能是浏览器正在请求页面以及其他资源，例如浏览器选项卡中显示的favicon.ico图标。

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, your Rust code might need to interact with code written in another language. For this, Rust has a keyword, extern, that facilitates the creation and use of a Foreign Function Interface (FFI). An FFI is a way for a programming language to define functions and enable a different (foreign) programming language to call those functions.
trans-unit.target: 有时，您的Rust代码可能需要与用另一种语言编写的代码进行交互。为此，Rust有一个关键字 extern ，它有助于创建和使用外函数接口（FFI）。 FFI是一种编程语言定义功能并允许其他（外国）编程语言调用这些功能的方法。

trans-unit.source: Soon we’ll define the impl_hello_macro function, which is where we’ll build the new Rust code we want to include. But before we do, note that the output for our derive macro is also a TokenStream. The returned TokenStream is added to the code that our crate users write, so when they compile their crate, they’ll get the extra functionality that we provide in the modified TokenStream.
trans-unit.target: 很快，我们将定义 impl_hello_macro 函数，在这里我们将构建要包含的新Rust代码。但在执行此操作之前，请注意，我们的派生宏的输出也是 TokenStream 。返回的 TokenStream 被添加到我们的板条箱用户编写的代码中，因此，当他们编译其板条箱时，他们将获得我们在修改后的 TokenStream 中提供的额外功能。

trans-unit.source: Sorting the content of a deque.

trans-unit.target: 对切片进行排序,具有键提取功能。

trans-unit.target: 对切片进行排序,但可能不会保留相等元素的顺序。

trans-unit.source: Spawns a new thread by taking ownership of the Builder, and returns an io::Result to its JoinHandle.
trans-unit.target: 通过获得 Builder 的所有权来产生新线程，并将 io::Result 返回到其 JoinHandle 。

trans-unit.source: Spawns a new thread without any lifetime restrictions by taking ownership of the Builder, and returns an io::Result to its JoinHandle.
trans-unit.target: 通过拥有 Builder 的所有权来产生一个不受任何生命周期限制的新线程，并将 io::Result 返回到其 JoinHandle 。

trans-unit.source: Spawns a new thread, returning a JoinHandle for it.
trans-unit.target: 产生一个新线程，为其返回一个 JoinHandle 。

trans-unit.source: Speaking of different ways to write this function, Listing 9-9 shows that there’s a way to make this even shorter.
trans-unit.target: 说到编写此函数的不同方法，清单9-9显示了有一种使它更短的方法。

trans-unit.source: Specialization only allows you to override default functions in implementations.
trans-unit.target: 专业化仅允许您覆盖实现中的 default 功能。

trans-unit.source: Specifically, size_hint() returns a tuple where the first element is the lower bound, and the second element is the upper bound.
trans-unit.target: 具体来说， size_hint() 返回一个元组，其中第一个元素是下限，第二个元素是上限。

trans-unit.source: Specifically, you’ll learn about variables, basic types, functions, comments, and control flow. These foundations will be in every Rust program, and learning them early will give you a strong core to start from.
trans-unit.target: 具体来说，您将了解变量，基本类型，函数，注释和控制流。这些基础将存在于每个Rust程序中，并且尽早学习它们将为您提供强大的起点。

trans-unit.source: Specifies parameters to generic type in a type (e.g., Vec<u8>)
trans-unit.target: 指定类型中通用类型的参数（例如 Vec<u8> ）

trans-unit.source: Specifies parameters to generic type, function, or method in an expression; often referred to as turbofish (e.g., "42".parse::<i32>())
trans-unit.target: 指定表达式中泛型类型，函数或方法的参数；通常称为turbofish（例如 "42".parse::<i32>() ）

trans-unit.source: Specifies the file extension used for shared libraries on this platform that goes after the dot. Example value is so.
trans-unit.target: 指定此平台上共享库所用的文件扩展名，该扩展名位于点后。示例值是 so 。

trans-unit.source: Specifies the file extension, if any, used for executable binaries on this platform. Example value is exe.
trans-unit.target: 指定用于此平台上的可执行二进制文件的文件扩展名（如果有）。示例值为 exe 。

trans-unit.source: Specifies the filename prefix used for shared libraries on this platform. Example value is lib.
trans-unit.target: 指定用于此平台上共享库的文件名前缀。示例值为 lib 。

trans-unit.source: Specifies the filename suffix used for executable binaries on this platform. Example value is .exe.
trans-unit.target: 指定用于此平台上的可执行二进制文件的文件名后缀。示例值为 .exe 。

trans-unit.source: Specifies the filename suffix used for shared libraries on this platform. Example value is .so.
trans-unit.target: 指定此平台上共享库使用的文件名后缀。示例值为 .so 。

trans-unit.source: Specify the code to run when a value goes out of scope by implementing the Drop trait. The Drop trait requires you to implement one method named drop that takes a mutable reference to self. To see when Rust calls drop, let’s implement drop with println! statements for now.
trans-unit.target: 通过实现 Drop trait，指定值超出范围时要运行的代码。该 Drop 特质需要您实现一个方法名为 drop ，需要一个可变引用 self 。要查看Rust调用何时 drop ，让我们使用 println! 实现 drop ！现在的陈述。

trans-unit.source: Specifying Multiple Trait Bounds with the + Syntax
trans-unit.target: 用 + 语法指定多个特征界线

trans-unit.source: Specifying Placeholder Types in Trait Definitions with Associated Types
trans-unit.target: 在特质定义中指定带有关联类型的占位符类型。

trans-unit.source: Specifying a relative path with use is slightly different. Instead of starting from a name in the current scope, we must start the path given to use with the keyword self. Listing 7-12 shows how to specify a relative path to get the same behavior as in Listing 7-11.
trans-unit.target: 指定使用相对路径 use 略有不同。与其从当前范围内的名称开始，我们必须开始 use 关键字 self 给出的要使用的路径。清单7-12显示了如何指定相对路径以获得与清单7-11相同的行为。

trans-unit.source: Specifying the trait name before the method name clarifies to Rust which implementation of fly we want to call. We could also write Human::fly(&person), which is equivalent to the person.fly() that we used in Listing 19-18, but this is a bit longer to write if we don’t need to disambiguate.
trans-unit.target: 在方法名称之前指定特征名称可以向Rust 告知我们要调用哪种 fly 实现。我们还可以编写 Human::fly(&person) ，它与清单19-18中使用的 person.fly() 等效，但是如果我们不需要消除歧义的话，这要花点时间写。

trans-unit.source: Split your program into a main.rs and a lib.rs and move your program’s logic to lib.rs.
trans-unit.target: 拆分程序到main.rs和lib.rs和移动你的程序的逻辑lib.rs。
